Vulnerability.Title: kpatch bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The kpatch packages are a means of dynamic patching for the Linux kernel. Specifically, kpatch allows for patching a Linux kernel without rebooting or restarting processes, works at the function level for replacing old functions with new functions via hot patch modules. The kpatch management tool has been upgraded to upstream version 0.1.1, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1096221) This update also fixes the following bug: Previously, the kpatch utility could only uninstall a hot patch module from the following directories: /var/lib/kpatch/ and /usr/lib/kpatch/. Consequently, if kpatch could not find the module in the respective directory, it was unable to uninstall the module. This update disposes of the distinction between /var/lib/kpatch/ and /usr/lib/kpatch/ directories, and introduces only one place where installed modules are saved. As a result, kpatch uninstalls hot patch modules as intended. (BZ#1100148) Users of kpatch are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
